Based on their message, they seem interested in adventure films. Two highly recommended movies from this genre are "Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark" (1981) directed by Steven Spielberg and "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade" (1980) also directed by Spielberg.

Both movies feature Indiana Jones (played by Harrison Ford)) on his adventures, solving mysteries, battling enemies and uncovering ancient artifacts. The stories take place in different historical periods such as ancient Egypt, ancient Greece, medieval Europe and 20th century.

"Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark" is a classic adventure film that has been praised for its exciting plot, memorable characters, impressive special effects and excellent musical score. It has become one of the most iconic and beloved adventure films ever made.

The second movie "Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade" also features Indiana Jones on his adventures as he tries to find the Holy Grail and defeat the终极敌人 Darth Vader. The story takes place in Europe during the 13th century, including cities such as Florence, Venice, Rome and Castile. The main characters include Indiana Jones (played by Harrison Ford)), Maria (also played by Jennifer Lawrence)), Sir Henry Blaine (played by Tom Cruise)), Elsa Schell (also played by Jennifer Lawrence)), the High Priest of Solomon's Temple (played by John Lithgow)), and the Head Mage of the Order of Mages (played by Stephen Rea)).

2. Moulin Rouge! - This is a historical musical film directed by Baz Luhrmann. The story follows the rise of the Moulin Rouge cabaret in Paris during the French Revolution. The film features a score composed by John Williams and lyrics written by Alan Bergman, Stephen Sondheim and Jeff Sklar. The film received critical acclaim, winning 10 awards including Best Picture.

I hope you find these recommendations helpful!
